hypothesis_content.title: Contrarian Fade of Post-News Muted Price Action
hypothesis_content.statement: When significant crypto news (e.g., major treasury purchase, regulatory headline) generates >300% average daily social/media volume but price reaction is muted (<±1.5% over 24h), a contrarian directional move (>2%) will occur within the next 36 hours, opposite to the initial minor drift.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High attention with low price impact suggests either the news is already priced in, or the market is digesting it and positioning for a reversal. 'Buy the rumor, sell the news' dynamics or trapped over-reactors.
entry_conditions: Crypto news event triggers >300% increase in news/social volume vs 7-day average (per data feed)
BTC or relevant asset price moves <|1.5%| in the 24 hours following news dissemination
Enter on the close of that 24-hour period
Trade direction: Fade the initial minor drift (e.g., if price drifted up +0.8%, enter short)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves >2% in the opposite direction of the initial drift
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves >1.5% in the direction of the initial drift (momentum confirms)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If muted price action following high-volume news is more likely to lead to continuation (>1.5%) in the same direction as the initial drift.
